item.title: Verification
item.description: Here are the files necessary to verify the authenticity of blog updates. The content in the commit files should match the git history for this site. The signatures should be verifyable with my public key, which can be found here: 0bfd_pub.asc or on public keyservers. See OpenTimestamps.org for more information on how to verify the timestamp files. I used their git integration as inspiration for what content to timestamp. Updates Date Summary Commit Timestamp

item.title: About
item.description: I’m a software engineer. This is stuff I’ve written. See this post for more info on the layout. This site is built using Hugo, based on the Bear Cub theme.

item.title: First Post
item.description: Before anything else, I want to write a bit about how I’ve set things up on the site. At some point later I’ll write about why I set it up this way. The blog is published as a git archive on GitHub. I use a static site generator (Hugo) to publish the content from markdown files. Each commit is signed with a GPG key that’s associated with my GitHub account, and the public key can be found in the repo and on keyservers.

item.title: GPG
item.description: GPG is short for GNU Privacy Guard. See wikipedia for more info. For the purposes of this site, here’s an oversimplification: it’s a cryptographic way to sign and verify content, to be sure that the content hasn’t been altered since the original signer signed the file. My public key can be found here: 0bfd_pub.asc.
